page.title: 05The` Spread Eagle'
page.content: In the midst of the village stands the Â£Spread EagleÂ£.It used to be a resting place for horses and their riders but now it is a pub,restaurant and hotel with thirteen rooms.It has a well- stocked garden with a large lawned area which is mainly used in summer time. Alongside the Â£Spread' runs the Alderbrook and many people,whilst enjoying a drink,will sit ,on the wall admiring the brook. PRIVATE NURSING HOME TheÂ£Dower House'was once a private house,owned by Sir Oswald Mosely.It is now a private nursing home.About fifty people work there including the Matron,Assistant Matron,Nurses and Nursing Assistants. At the time of our visit there were fifteen patients plus six recovering from operations.
